inclusion.criterion: SBP > 89 mm Hg unless patient has a known prior history of low blood pressure, and blood oxygen saturation of >80%
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of acute PE requires symptoms of PE present <14 days with CT angiography interpreted as positive for acute PE
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: All patients must have CT chest angiography with <2 mm collimation, with or without indirect venography
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: SBP > 89 mm Hg at the time of enrollment. We will allow enrollment for a patient with an SBP < 90 mm Hg prior to enrollment, or a patient with a SBP>80 mm Hg, if the patient has a documented or patient-identified history of low blood pressure and has no symptoms of shock
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients must have a Borg score greater than 4/10
inclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has chronic hypoxemia and dyspnea thought due to diastolic CHF, pulmonary hypertension thought secondary to a chronic ASD and COPD on 5L home oxygen. Patient tolerated an inpatient trial of sildenafil without hypotension.
